00002 // linalg3dII.h
00003 //
00004 
00005 #pragma once
00006 #include "Misc.h"
00007 #include "linalg3d.h"
00008 
00009 class Helix
00010 {
00011 public:
00012   /* data */
00013   Vec  start, end, center, normal, rTan, rPerp, rHelix;
00014   REAL radius, spiral, angle;
00015   int turn;
00016   REAL  startingangle, endingangle;
00017 
00018   Helix() {};
00019   Helix(Vec &vstart, Vec &vend, Vec & vcenter, Vec & vnormal, int turn)
00020   {  Init(vstart, vend, vcenter,  vnormal, turn); }
00021 
00022   //L = sqrt(H^2 + (2 pi R)^2)  Hyptoeneuse analogy -> helix height per arc circumference 
00023   REAL GetArcLength()   { return hypot(rHelix.Len(), radius*angle); }
00024   Vec GetArcPoint(REAL dDist) { return ArcPoint((dDist/GetArcLength()) * angle); }
00025 
00026   /* turn: 0 = 0..360, 1 = 360..720, -1 = 0..-360, -2 = -360..-720, etc.  */
00027   HRESULT Init(Vec &vstart, Vec &vend,  Vec &vcenter, Vec &vnormal, int nTurn)
00028   {
00029     Vec rEnd;
00030     Vec v;
00031 
00032     // Initialize arc
00033     start=vstart;center=vcenter;end=vend; normal=vnormal.Normalize(); turn=nTurn;
00034 
00035     if(normal.Len()< EPSILON)
00036       return E_FAIL;
00037 
00038     /*The center vector and start vector are assumed to be in the plane defined by the normal vector. 
00039     If this is not true, then it will be made true by moving the center vector onto the plane.
00040     */
00041     center=Projection(start-center, normal)+ center; 
00042 
00043     /* normalize and redirect normal vector based on turns. If turn is
00044     less than 0, point normal vector in other direction and make turn positive, -1 -> 0, -2 -> 1, etc. */
00045     if (turn < 0)
00046     {
00047       turn = -1 - turn;
00048       normal*= -1.0; // pmCartScalMult(circle->normal, -1.0, &circle->normal);
00049     }
00050 
00051     /* radius - assume start and center coplanar*/
00052     radius= Displacement(start, center);//  pmCartCartDisp(start.tran, circle->center, &circle->radius);
00053 
00054     /* vector in plane of circle from center to start, magnitude radius */
00055     rTan=start-center;  //pmCartCartSub(start.tran, circle->center, &circle->rTan);
00056 
00057     /* vector in plane of circle perpendicular to rTan, magnitude radius */
00058     rPerp=Cross(normal, rTan);  //pmCartCartCross(circle->normal, circle->rTan, &circle->rPerp);
00059 
00060     /* do rHelix, rEnd */
00061     rHelix=end-center; // pmCartCartSub(end.tran, circle->center, &circle->rHelix);
00062     rEnd = CartPlaneProj(rHelix, normal); // pmCartPlaneProj(circle->rHelix, circle->normal, &rEnd);
00063     spiral=  rEnd.Len() - radius; // pmCartMag(rEnd, &circle->spiral);
00064     // spiral -= radius;
00065     rHelix=rHelix-rEnd; //pmCartCartSub(circle->rHelix, rEnd, &circle->rHelix);
00066     // pmCartNorm(rEnd, &rEnd);
00067     rEnd=rEnd.Normalize() * radius;  //pmCartScalMult(rEnd, circle->radius, &rEnd);
00068 
00069     REAL d =rEnd.Len();
00070 
00071     if(d == 0.0)
00072     {
00073       rEnd+=normal*EPSILON; // pmCartCartAdd(rEnd, v, &rEnd);
00074     }
00075 
00076     /* angle */
00077     REAL dDot = Dot(rTan, rEnd)/ (radius * radius); //pmCartCartDot(circle->rTan, rEnd, &dot);
00078     if(dDot>1.0)
00079     {
00080       angle=0;
00081     }
00082     else if(dDot<-1.0)
00083     {
00084       angle=PI;
00085     }
00086     else
00087     {
00088       angle=acos(dDot);
00089     }
00090 
00091     /* now angle is in range 0..PI . Check if cross is antiparallel to
00092     normal. If so, true angle is between PI..2PI. Need to subtract
00093     from 2PI. */
00094     v= Cross(rTan, rEnd); // pmCartCartCross(circle->rTan, rEnd, &v);
00095     dDot=Dot(v, normal); // pmCartCartDot(v, circle->normal, &d);
00096     if (dDot < 0.0)
00097       angle = 2*PI - angle;
00098     if (angle > -(EPSILON) && angle < (EPSILON) )
00099     {
00100       angle = TwoPI; 
00101     }
00102 
00103     /* now add more angle for multi turns */
00104     if (turn > 0)
00105     {
00106       angle += turn * TwoPI;
00107     }
00108 
00109     return S_OK;
00110   }
00111 
00112   /*
00113   ArcPoint returns the vector to the point at the given angle along
00114   the circle. If the circle is a helix or spiral or combination, the
00115   point will include interpolation off the actual circle.
00116   */
00117   Vec ArcPoint(REAL dAngle)
00118   {
00119     /* compute components rel to center */
00120     Vec par(rTan*cos(dAngle));
00121     Vec perp(rPerp*sin(dAngle));
00122 
00123     /* add to get radius vector rel to center */
00124     Vec  point(par+perp);
00125 
00126     REAL scale;
00127     if (this->angle == 0.0)
00128       return point;
00129 
00130     /* get scale for spiral, helix interpolation */
00131     scale = dAngle / angle;
00132 
00133     /* add scaled vector in radial dir for spiral */
00134     par = point.Normalize(); // pmCartUnit(point->tran, &par);
00135     par*=(scale * spiral); // pmCartScalMult(par, scale * circle->spiral, &par);
00136     point+= par; // pmCartCartAdd(point->tran, par, &point->tran);
00137 
00138     /* add scaled vector in helix dir - e.g., 0..difference in z*/
00139     point+=rHelix*scale; // pmCartScalMult(circle->rHelix, scale, &perp);
00140     // pmCartCartAdd(point->tran, perp, &point->tran);
00141 
00142     /* add to center vector for final result */
00143     point+=center; // pmCartCartAdd(circle->center, point->tran, &point->tran);
00144 
00145     return point;
00146   }
00147   HRESULT Compute2DArc(                           
00148     int move,           /* either -1 (cw arc) or 1 (ccw arc)             */
00149     Vec &  current,   /* current point                */
00150     Vec &  end,   /* current point                */
00151     REAL radius,  /* radius of arc                                    */
00152     REAL &center_x, REAL &center_y,
00153     int & turn)
00154   {
00155     Vec  mid((end+current)/2.0);      /* point P */
00156     REAL abs_radius(fabs(radius));  /* absolute value of given radius */
00157     REAL half_length; /* distance from M to end point   */
00158     REAL offset;      /* distance from M to center      */
00159     REAL theta;       /* angle of line from M to center */
00160     REAL turn2;       /* absolute value of half of turn */
00161 
00162     if ((end-current).Len()< EPSILON)
00163       return E_FAIL;
00164 
00165     half_length = hypot((mid.x - end.x), (mid.y - end.y));
00166 
00167     //CHK(((half_length/abs_radius) > (1+TINY)),
00168     //    NCE_ARC_RADIUS_TOO_SMALL_TO_REACH_END_POINT);
00169 
00170     if ((half_length/abs_radius) > (1-EPSILON))
00171       half_length = abs_radius; /* allow a small error for semicircle */
00172 
00173     /* check needed before calling asin   */
00174     if (((move == -1) && (radius > 0)) || ((move == 1) && (radius < 0)))
00175       theta = atan2((end.y - current.y), (end.x - current.x)) - TwoPI;
00176     else
00177       theta = atan2((end.y - current.y), (end.x - current.x)) + TwoPI;
00178 
00179     turn2 = asin (half_length/abs_radius);
00180     offset = abs_radius * cos(turn2);
00181     center_x = mid.x + (offset * cos(theta));
00182     center_y = mid.y + (offset * sin(theta));
00183     turn = (move == -1) ? -1 : 1;
00184 
00185     return S_OK;
00186   }
00187 
00188 };
00189 
00190 class Quat
00191 {
00192 public:
00193   typedef REAL T;
00194   REAL x,y,z,w;
00195   Quat(){  x = y = z = (T)0.0; w = (T)1.0; }
00196   Quat( const T& i, const T& j, const T& k, const T& s ) {x = i;  y = j; z =k ;  w = s;}
00197   Quat( const Vec& v, const T& s ) {  x = v.x;  y = v.y; z =v.z ;  w = s; }
00198   Quat &operator *= ( const REAL src ) { x *= src; y *= src; z *= src; w *= src; return *this; }
00199   Quat operator * ( const REAL src ) const { Quat tmp( *this ); return ( tmp *= src ); }
00200   Quat& operator+=( const Quat& a) { x+=a.x; y+=a.y; z+=a.z; w+=a.w; return *this;}
00201   Quat operator+( const Quat& a) {Quat tmp(*this);  return (tmp+=a);}
00202   REAL length()
00203   {
00204     return sqrt(x * x + y * y +
00205       z * z + w * w);
00206   }
00207   Quat normalize(Quat  quat)
00208   {
00209     double L = quat.length();
00210 
00211     quat.x /= L;
00212     quat.y /= L;
00213     quat.z /= L;
00214     quat.w /= L;
00215 
00216     return quat;
00217   }
00218   Quat & normalize()
00219   {
00220     double L = length();
00221     x /= L; y /= L; z /= L; w /= L;
00222     return *this;
00223   }
00224 
00225 
00226   Quat operator *( const Quat& a) 
00227   { 
00228     Quat tmp; 
00229     tmp.w = (a.w*w) - (a.x*x) - (a.y*y) - (a.z*z);
00230 
00231     tmp.x = (a.w*x) + (a.x*w) + (a.y*z) - (a.z*y);
00232     tmp.y     = (a.w*y) + (a.y*w) + (a.z*x) - (a.x*z);
00233     tmp.z      = (a.w*z) + (a.z*w) + (a.x*y) - (a.y*x);
00234   }
00235 #if 0
00236   if (qout->s >= 0.0)
00237   {
00238     qout->x = q1.s * q2.x + q1.x * q2.s + q1.y * q2.z - q1.z * q2.y;
00239     qout->y = q1.s * q2.y - q1.x * q2.z + q1.y * q2.s + q1.z * q2.x;
00240     qout->z = q1.s * q2.z + q1.x * q2.y - q1.y * q2.x + q1.z * q2.s;
00241   }
00242   else
00243   {
00244     qout->s *= -1;
00245     qout->x = - q1.s * q2.x - q1.x * q2.s - q1.y * q2.z + q1.z * q2.y;
00246     qout->y = - q1.s * q2.y + q1.x * q2.z - q1.y * q2.s - q1.z * q2.x;
00247     qout->z = - q1.s * q2.z - q1.x * q2.y + q1.y * q2.x - q1.z * q2.s;
00248   }
00249 #endif
00250   Vec operator *(const Vec & v2)
00251   {
00252     Vec c, tmp;
00253     Quat  q1(*this);
00254 
00255     c.x = q1.y * v2.z  -  q1.z * v2.y;
00256     c.y = q1.z * v2.x  -  q1.x * v2.z;
00257     c.z = q1.x * v2.y  -  q1.y * v2.x;
00258 
00259     tmp.x = v2.x + 2.0 * (q1.w * c.x + q1.y * c.z - q1.z * c.y);
00260     tmp.y = v2.y + 2.0 * (q1.w * c.y + q1.z * c.x - q1.x * c.z);
00261     tmp.z = v2.z + 2.0 * (q1.w * c.z + q1.x * c.y - q1.y * c.x);
00262   }
00263 
00264   Quat slerp(Quat & qa, Quat & qb, REAL t) {
00265     // quaternion to return
00266     Quat qm ;
00267 
00268     // Calculate angle beteen them.
00269     REAL costheta = qa.w * qb.w + qa.x * qb.x + qa.y * qb.y + qa.z * qb.z;
00270     REAL theta = acos(costheta);
00271 
00272     // if theta = 0 then return qa
00273     if (fabs(theta) < 0.01){
00274       qm.w = qa.w;qm.x = qa.x;qm.y = qa.y;qm.z = qa.z;
00275       return qm;
00276     }
00277     // Calculate temporary values.
00278     REAL sinTheta = sqrt(1.0 - costheta*costheta);
00279     // if theta*2 = 180 degrees then result is undefined
00280     if (fabs(sinTheta) < 0.01){
00281       qm.w = (qa.w * 0.5 + qb.w * 0.5);
00282       qm.x = (qa.x * 0.5 + qb.x * 0.5);
00283       qm.y = (qa.y * 0.5 + qb.y * 0.5);
00284       qm.z = (qa.z * 0.5 + qb.z * 0.5);
00285       return qm;
00286     }
00287     REAL ratioA = sin((1 - t) * theta) / sinTheta;
00288     REAL ratioB = sin(t * theta) / sinTheta;
00289 
00290     //calculate Quaternion.
00291     qm.w = (qa.w * ratioA + qb.w * ratioB);
00292     qm.x = (qa.x * ratioA + qb.x * ratioB);
00293     qm.y = (qa.y * ratioA + qb.y * ratioB);
00294     qm.z = (qa.z * ratioA + qb.z * ratioB);
00295     return qm;
00296   }
00297 
00298 };
00299 
00300 inline Quat Conjugate(Quat &q) { Quat tmp(q); tmp.x-=q.x; tmp.y-=q.y;tmp.z-=q.z; return tmp; }
00301 inline Quat Inverse(Quat &q) { Quat tmp(q);  REAL invs = sqrt(Sq(q.x) + Sq(q.y)+Sq(q.z)+Sq(q.w)); tmp*=1/invs; return tmp;  }
00302 //  q = cos(a/2) + i ( x * sin(a/2)) + j (y * sin(a/2)) + k ( z * sin(a/2))
00303 // Thanks to http://www.euclideanspace.com/maths/geometry/rotations/conversions/quaternionToMatrix/index.htm 
00304 inline Mtx Quat2Mtx(Quat &q)
00305 {
00306   Mtx m;
00307 
00308   // Faster code (without sqrt) below
00309   REAL sqw = q.w*q.w;    
00310   REAL sqx = q.x*q.x;    
00311   REAL sqy = q.y*q.y;    
00312   REAL sqz = q.z*q.z;
00313   // invs (inverse square length) is only required if quaternion is not already normalised    
00314   REAL invs = 1 / (sqx + sqy + sqz + sqw) ;  
00315 
00316   m(0,0) = ( sqx - sqy - sqz + sqw)*invs ; // since sqw + sqx + sqy + sqz =1/invs*invs    
00317   m(1,1)= (-sqx + sqy - sqz + sqw)*invs ;    
00318   m(2,2) = (-sqx - sqy + sqz + sqw)*invs ;   
00319 
00320   REAL tmp1 = q.x*q.y;    
00321   REAL tmp2 = q.z*q.w;   
00322   m(1,0) = 2.0 * (tmp1 + tmp2)*invs ;    
00323   m(0,1)   = 2.0 * (tmp1 - tmp2)*invs ;        
00324 
00325   tmp1 = q.x*q.z;    tmp2 = q.y*q.w;    
00326   m(2,0) = 2.0 * (tmp1 - tmp2)*invs ;    
00327   m(0,2)  = 2.0 * (tmp1 + tmp2)*invs ;    
00328   tmp1 = q.y*q.z;    
00329   tmp2 = q.x*q.w;    
00330   m(2,1) = 2.0 * (tmp1 + tmp2)*invs ;    
00331   m(1,2) = 2.0 * (tmp1 - tmp2)*invs ;      
00332   return m;
00333 }
00334 
00335 inline Quat Mtx2Quat( Mtx & a)  
00336 {
00337   Quat q ;
00338   REAL trace = a(0,0) + a(1,1) + a(2,2) + 1.0;  
00339   if( trace > EPSILON ) 
00340   {
00341     REAL s = 0.5f / sqrt(trace);
00342     q.w = 0.25f / s;
00343     q.x = ( a(2,1) - a(1,2) ) * s;
00344     q.y = ( a(0,2) - a(2,0) ) * s;
00345     q.z = ( a(1,0) - a(0,1)) * s;
00346   } else
00347   {
00348     if ( a(0,0) > a(1,1) && a(0,0) > a(2,2) ) 
00349     {
00350       REAL s = 2.0f * sqrt( 1.0 + a(0,0) - a(1,1) - a(2,2));
00351       q.x = 0.25f * s;
00352       q.y = (a(0,1) + a(1,0) ) / s;
00353       q.z = (a(0,2) + a(2,0) ) / s;
00354       q.w = (a(1,2) - a(2,1) ) / s;    
00355     } 
00356     else if (a(1,1) > a(2,2)) 
00357     {
00358       REAL s = 2.0f * sqrt( 1.0 + a(1,1) - a(0,0) - a(2,2));
00359       q.x = (a(0,1) + a(1,0) ) / s;
00360       q.y = 0.25f * s;
00361       q.z = (a(1,2) + a(2,1) ) / s;
00362       q.w = (a(0,2) - a(2,0) ) / s;    
00363     } 
00364     else {
00365       REAL s = 2.0f * sqrt( 1.0 + a(2,2) - a(0,0) - a(1,1) );
00366       q.x = (a(0,2) + a(2,0) ) / s;
00367       q.y = (a(1,2) + a(2,1) ) / s;
00368       q.z = 0.25f * s;
00369       q.w = (a(0,1) - a(1,0 )) / s;
00370     }
00371   }
00372   return q;
00373 }
00374 // roll=heading, attitude = pitch, bank=yaw
00375 inline Quat RPYEuler2Quat(REAL roll, REAL pitch, REAL yaw) 
00376 {    // Assuming the angles are in radians.    
00377   REAL c1 = cos(roll/2);    
00378   REAL s1 = sin(roll/2);    
00379   REAL c2 = cos(pitch/2);    
00380   REAL s2 = sin(pitch/2);    
00381   REAL c3 = cos(yaw/2);    
00382   REAL s3 = sin(yaw/2);
00383   REAL c1c2 = c1*c2;    
00384   REAL s1s2 = s1*s2;    
00385   REAL w =c1c2*c3 - s1s2*s3;
00386   REAL x =c1c2*s3 + s1s2*c3;
00387   REAL y =s1*c2*c3 + c1*s2*s3;
00388   REAL z =c1*s2*c3 - s1*c2*s3;
00389   return Quat(x,y,z,w);
00390 }
00391 inline CString ToString(Quat &q){ return StrFormat(_T("%f i%f j%f k%f\n"), q.w, q.x,q.y,q.z); }
